DOC.brief_summary: The objective of the study is to investigate whether peri-operative symbiotic treatment could reduce the risk of postoperative infections in patients undergoing elective colorectal surgery. This study was also designed to assess the risk-adjusted incidence and predictors of surgical site infections.
DOC.brief_title: Evaluation of the Effect of Preoperative Symbiotic Bowel Conditioning on Surgical Site Infection After Elective Colorectal Surgery
DOC.criteria: 1. Both genders 2. More than 14 years old 3. Candidate for elective colorectal surgery 1. Denied written informed consent, 2. Severe neutropenia, and 3. Critically ill condition 4. Not meeting inclusion criteria
